description.narrative: Within the context of the country's longer-term interests in disaster hazard mitigation, the development objective of the proposed Disaster Hazard Mitigation Project (DHMP) is to: (i) minimize the exposure of humans, livestock, and riverine flora and fauna to radionuclides associated with abandoned uranium mine tailings and waste rock dumps in the Mailuu-Suu area;(ii) improve the effectiveness of emergency management and response by national and sub-national authorities and local communities to disaster situations; and (iii) reduce the loss of life and property in key landslide areas of the country. These objectives will be accomplished through key mitigation measures designed to: (i) isolate and protect abandoned uranium mine tailings and waste rock dumps from disturbance by natural processes such as landslides and floods, and from leaching and dispersal processes associated with ground- and surface-water drainage; isolate long-standing hazards and prevent their disturbance; (ii) create an effective disaster management and response system; and (iii) develop a system to detect and warn against active landslide movements in about 20 key hazard areas.

condition.narrative: The Recipient shall establish and maintain a National Emergency Management Committee with membership from relevant ministries andagencies involved in disaster emergency management and response.
The Recipient shall not make expenditures for moving tailing #3 until priority activities have been described in a feasibility anddesign study, agreed by IDA.

title.narrative: Ability to communicate within MES improved as a step towards effective emergency management.

baseline.value: Ability to communicate only via telephone, which is unreliable in remote areas.

target.value: Capacity to communicate between the new Osh HQ, Bishkek and all oblasts in place.

actual.value: Communication equipment is installed, maintained, functional and in frequent use.

comment.narrative: Osh continues to be an effective and functioning communication hub, which performed well during the avalanche responsecoordinationby MES in March 2012.

title.narrative: Progress towards improved isolation and protection of uranium wastes from disturbance by landslides, floods, and leaching and dispersal by ground- and surface-water drainage in the Mailuu Suu area.

target.value: Necessary interventions for selected high-risk tailings and waste dumps agreed and works ongoing or completed.

actual.value: Interventions for high risk facilities completed 98%, mitigation of key risks achieved.

comment.narrative: Some delays encountered due to repeated flooding due to extreme precipitation, and a very harsh and long winter 2011/12

title.narrative: Evidence that a disaster hazard monitoring, warning and response system is functioning and being used effectively by cooperating national, oblast, and raion authorities, and local communities.

baseline.value: No evidence of improved effectiveness, as system not in place, with response only in case of serious disasters.

target.value: Emergency ResponseCenters established andoperative around theclock and the responsetime for all inventoriedpotentiallandslideareas lies below 24 hrs.

comment.narrative: Nat Agency for Tailings Management assumes full, responsibility, for O&M as well as early warning and emergency response.

actual.value: Emergency ResponseCenters established in Bishkek and Osh, operative around theclock and the responsetime for allinventoriedpotential landslideareas lies below 24 hrs.

comment.narrative: National Radiation Safety Agency is progressively assuming responsibility for finalized objects under project.

title.narrative: Evidence that real-time landslide monitoring, warning and response systems are functioning and being used effectively by cooperating national, oblast, and rayon authorities, and local communities.

baseline.value: No systems in place, thus no evidence.

target.value: Twenty landslide areashave been surveyed. Five landslidemonitoring and warningsystems installed andpopulation trained intheiruse. Fullyoperational andmonitored by localauthorities and MES.

comment.narrative: Costs per landslideexceeded the estimatedcosts due to highcomplexity of selectedhigh risk sites. Fivelandslide areaswereequipped.

actual.value: One landslidemonitoring and warningsystems installed andpopulation trained inits use. Fullyoperational andmonitored by localcommunity, authorities and MES.

comment.narrative: Activity not expected to recover from severe setbacks during civil unrest (theft and vandalism) and related hiatus in projectmanagement. Focus now on community based low tech / low cost monitoring and maintenance.

title.narrative: Evidence that applicable parameters are below hazardous thresholds for humans and livestock in samples of soil, water and air from monitored sites in the Mailuu-Suu area.

baseline.value: Toxic and radioactive parameters intermittently above internationally accepted thresholds.

target.value: Discontinuation ofpollution infiltration ofradionuclides andassociated heavy metalsinto the groundwaterfrom selectedhigh-riskmine tailings and wastedumps.

comment.narrative: Discontinuation ofpollution infiltration ofradionuclides andassociated heavy metalsinto the groundwaterfrom selectedhigh-riskmine tailings and wastedumps is used as a validproxy PDO indicator tomeasure the impact ofpublic healthoutcomeduring the lifeof theproject, as impact ofremediation measuresin groundwaterdownstream can onlybe measured aftertheproject closure.

actual.value: Near-complete (ca. 98%) reduction ofpollution sources ofradionuclides andassociated heavy metalsinto the groundwater fromfromhigh-riskmine tailings and wastedumps (e.g. TMF03, WD01, WD02, WD05, WD06, TMF2 and TMF13). remaining wirks include surfacedrainage, landscaping and greening.MES and National Agency for Radiation Safety (renamed into Nat Agency for Management ofTailings Facilities) need to agree on long term operation and maintenance plan for remediated sites, including budget line.

comment.narrative: Discontinuation ofpollution infiltration ofradionuclides andassociated heavy metalsinto the groundwaterfrom selectedhigh-riskmine tailings and wastedumps is used as a validproxy PDO indicator tomeasure the impact ofpublic healthoutcomeduring the lifeof theproject, as impact ofremediation measuresin groundwaterdownstream can onlybe measured aftertheproject closure.
